required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Antibacterial Activity of Urea Against Ocular Bacteria
clinical_study.official_title: In Vitro Evaluation of Antibacterial Activity of Urea Solution Against Ocular Bacterial Isolates

brief_summary.textblock: Antibacterial properties of urea was tested against 35 isolates from ocular infections.

detailed_description.textblock:
In vitro susceptibility testing was performed with commercially available antibiotic discs, homemade urea discs saturated with urea solution at a concentration of 96 mmol. The weight of urea in one drop = 0.37 mg, in one ml = 10.34 mg (5 microliter/ disc) discs and combined discs (antibiotic discs to which urea solution was added). Combined discs provided better in vitro susceptibility results than antibiotics alone.
Scanning electron micrographs of bacterial isolates incubated overnight with urea solution showed marked disruption of bacterial aggregative patterns and irregularities of their cell walls.
Western blotting showed marked reduction in total proteins in bacterial isolates incubated overnight with urea solution. These findings may explain the possible mechanisms for antibacterial activity of urea solution as a result of protein denaturation.

primary_outcome.measure: Antibacterial effect of Urea Solution against Ocular Bacterial
primary_outcome.description: Samples were both inoculated on Muller Agar (Sigma-Aldrich) plates and directly examined under the microscope using Gram stained smears. Inoculated plates were incubated at 37oC for 48 hrs. Gram negative isolates were sub-cultured on MacConkey's, Eosin Methelyene Blue (EMB) and Cystine Lactose Electrolyte Deficient (CLED) agar plates (Sigma-Aldrich). Gram positive isolates were sub-cultured on Mannitol Salt agar plates (Sigma-Aldrich).

arm_group.description: Activity of Urea Solution against Ocular Bacterial Isolates

intervention.description: Antibacterial Activity of Urea Solution against Ocular Bacterial Isolates

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ocular infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Local antibiotics treatment
